entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Blowing Snow In Passes Friday Evening Through Saturday Evening... Snow developing on Friday evening will combine with south winds to cause blowing snow and reduced visibility in passes. There is a possibility that low visibility from the blowing snow will occur in passes from Friday evening through Saturday night.

entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet. * WHERE...Beaches of Vieques, Aguada and Rincon in Puerto Rico. Also north and west Saint Thomas and north Saint John.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 11:43AM PST until March 04 at 7:55AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The flood waters are cresting on the Chehalis river at Porter and will gradually recede below flood stage late Thursday night. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING...

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued March 03 at 5:38PM MST until March 04 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Visibility less than one half mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Wyoming and northwestern and southwestern South Dakota. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
